item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Actually, it would be better to use the forum for this discussion. Once we've found the root of this problem we can sort out a patch and everything here.

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/53873?replies=1

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Odd... never heard of anything like that. Could you install the dump environment plugin: ​http://dev.wp-plugins.org/file/dump_env/trunk/dump_env.php?rev=4235 and tell us the output. The Categories box is set to a maximum height and has a scrollbar so you can get to the lower categories, so could that be your problem?

Can you work out any pattern to which categories are missing? Could you list _exactly_ which categories are in your DB and which ones aren't showing up?

item.title: Ticket #2182 (TinyMCE (rich text editor) Tooltips are wrong in Mac Browsers) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description: Macs don't have ALT keys, CTRL is the meta key for accesskeys on the Mac. Need a browser detect branch in the code to show the proper meta key in the tooltip.

item.title: Ticket #2181 (There needs to be a get_comments_rss_link) created
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Currently, using default template tags, you can only output an RSS anchor, you can't get and output the RSS link itself. This is a problem if you for instance want to add a class to the anchor. Also, the comments_rss_link template tag could do with 'before' and 'after' parameters.

item.title: Ticket #2133 (No Cut & Paste When Editing using Opera (on Linux)) updated
item.dc:creator: jcwinnie
item.description: Occurs in 2.0, too, Browse Happy People!

item.title: Ticket #2180 (Closed comments doesn't surround the output of comments_popup_link ...) created
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: When using comments_popup_link, the fourth parameter sets the class of the link around the comments. However, if the comments are closed on an entry, no class is set. It would perhaps be preferable if there was a 'before' and 'after' parameter set, so one could surround the comment with a span or something similar.

item.title: Ticket #2179 (Categories Missing / Removed) created
item.dc:creator: jcwinnie
item.description:
From either Write or Edit, some catergories are missing from the selectable with checkbox list of categories, to include Uncategorized. Occurence with either Firefox or Opera on Linux and Win98 systems, so one might assume that someone borked it to undertand it.

Restored functionality would be appreciated by someone using WP daily throughout the day. Thanks.

item.title: Ticket #2166 (# in uploaded image filename breaks uploader) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Status changed

wp-admin/admin-functions.php line 1752 is the only place that needs rawurlencode. However, when I test in FF and IE, %23 is in the src and href but the browser decodes it and puts # in the request, which of course gets a 404.

I think it would be better to replace # with _

Can you fix this by adding a ? to the regex in the first replacement block? Like:

return preg_replace('%(<!--.*?-->)|(<'.# EITHER: <

item.description: Priority changed

item.title: Ticket #2157 (Published Articles for Future Appearance Get Counted in Categories) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
wontfix:

This can't be done with WordPress' current setup. When setting category_count, we can discount future posts, but as, currently, no events can be triggered when a future post is published, we can't decrement it then. There are bugs to get a scheduler (see #1637) built into WP, so this is another reason why that would be a good thing :)

item.title: Ticket #2172 (Private posts and unapproved comments show up in RSS feeds.) closed
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
worksforme:

Hmm... actually I can't replicate either parts of this in 1.5.2. I asked in #wordpress and got someone else (pwaring) with a 1.5.2 to test, he couldn't replicate either. Closing with worksforme.

By the way, when you want to 'publish' a private post, you have to hit 'Save' instead of 'Publish' (hitting Publish causes it to be a public post), perhaps that's the problem?

item.title: Ticket #2172 (Private posts and unapproved comments show up in RSS feeds.) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: In 2.0 (our current stable release), neither private posts nor unapproved comments show up in feeds. So this is not a bug in 2.0. Not closing as this could be a candidate for backporting if we release a new version on the 1.5 branch.

item.title: Ticket #2175 (mySQL 5, PHP5 : Cannot save a post) created
item.dc:creator: Podz
item.description:
Possible bug report...

Just upgraded to MySQL 5, PHP5, and WP 2.0 on an IIS 6 box. So far so good, however, when I try and create a new entry in WP, I must click "post" before I can click "save". If I click "save", I get this:

WordPress database error: [Incorrect datetime value: for column 'post_date' at row 1]

Should I be able to save here? Should the save button maybe be disabled until the post has actually been submitted?

​http://wordpress.org/support/topic/53655?replies=1

item.title: Ticket #2160 (get_post_custom_values() broken?) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
I'm not entirely sure as to how that function should work, so I guessed. It was the same in 1.5.2 as it is now, but that is a buggy state. I've attached a patch that works in the following way:

get_post_custom_values() has an optional values parameter. If you pass it, the function will return all values with that key. If you don't pass it, or you pass an empty parameter, the function acts exactly like get_post_custom (in fact, it just calls get_post_custom :))

item.title: Changeset [3378]: More wp_upload_bits() fixes.
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: More wp_upload_bits() fixes.

item.title: Ticket #2172 (Private posts and unapproved comments show up in RSS feeds.) created
item.dc:creator: creachadair
item.description:
In WordPress 1.5.2, posts that are marked "Private" show up in the RSS feed for the blog. This appears to contradict the documentation, which says (​http://wordpress.org/docs/reference/post):

"Posts marked as `Private' are not visable to any other authors regardless of user levels."

A useful workaround was suggested: Fill in the "Excerpt" field. Following the link from the RSS feed to the blog itself will not give you the formatted post, so the RSS user will only see the excerpt. However, I would argue that the spirit of the "private" marking is that the post should not show up for public consumption without further action on the part of the author.

Related to this, comments which have been held for approval show up in the comments RSS prior to approval. I don't know if any search engines are using RSS feeds to index blogs, but if so, this is a bootstrap route for comment spam.

item.title: Ticket #2171 (Mysql 5 and STRICT mode (and possibly WIMP)) created
item.dc:creator: handySolo
item.description:
Running mysql 5 in strict mode with WP release 2.0 (also observed in beta 2 rc3). IIS 6 / win2k3.

Can't save drafts. No errors displayed. No posts saved. They disappear into the ether. Same behavior for "Save and Continue Editing".

More discription in forum: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=53016&replies=5 (titled "Dude, where's my draft?").

item.dc:creator: mazalien
item.description:
I have uploaded the new file and made a test comment. Nothing changeed. This does not work correctly even in the adminarea (manage-post-area) only the old amount of comments shows up next to the post. But in the comment edit area the comments are really there...

But when re-editing a comment and save it agian the counter starts to work again.

item.title: Ticket #2170 (some cleanup work should be done in upgrade.php for trackback issue) created
item.dc:creator: knight
item.description: My original post is here ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=53416&replies=1 i think that since the trackback method is changed, there should be a cleaup process added in the upgrade.php for cleanup the db to_ping field, because if there is some char ( example \n\r ) in the to_ping field this will cause none of the trackback can be send

item.title: Ticket #2159 (Comment Counter off again) reopened
item.dc:creator: mazalien
item.description:
After upgrading from wp 1.5.2 to wp-2.0 the new version has stopped counting my comments below the posts.It only shows the old amount of comments and not the new ones that were added after upgrading.

For example if there where 4 comments before upgrade below the post the tag comments_popup_link said ; 4 comments. After upgrade it still says that there are four comments even there where new ones added.
